result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Marie Gulley

defendant.name: Gulley, Nicole Marie
defendant.address: 150 North Main Street, West Bend, WI 53095

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicole Marie Gulley appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Nicole Marie Gulley.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. Defense in receipt of discovery and global offer and requests more time to review with client. State does not object. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Nicole Marie Gulley appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Nicole Marie Gulley.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court with 22CM1716 which has been adjourned. This case to follow.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a hearing. The defendant has another case, 22CM1716, set for an initial appearance which has been adjourned. This case to follow.  Hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Nicole Marie Gulley not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests hearing date on defendant's other case that needs an initial appearance.  Defendant to be produced from Washington County by zoom for next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  rescheduling of upcoming court date.  (Nicole M. Gulley, Washington County Jail, 500 Rolfs Ave, West Bend WI 53090).
Oral No Contact Order with Meijer Foods in Wauwatosa.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Nicole Marie Gulley in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Nicole Marie Gulley in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicole Marie Gulley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicole Marie Gulley not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 4/28/2022. Defendant is in custody at Washington County Jail. Needs to be produced for court.
Letter from defendant requesting a new court date and that hearing be held via ZOOM.  (Nicole M. Gulley, Washington County Jail, 500 Rolfs Ave, West Bend WI 53090).
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/28/2022@02:00pm
